turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Thank you, Mr. Olson.
Mr. Bender, you have 2 minutes remaining.

turn.speaker: stephen_g_breyer
turn.label: Justice Stephen G. Breyer
turn.text: I've a very quick question, which is, the main point, single sex education will disappear if we adopt your brief word for word.
Suppose you decided that you needed single sex academies in inner cities.
If we adopt your brief word for word, have we decided that case?

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: No, not at all.
First of all, of course, you haven't decided the private single sex education for reasons that I think are clear, but even with regard to public single sex--

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: Wait, only private single sex education that gets any assistance from the Government.

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: --No, I don't think that's true, Justice Scalia.
The Court State action cases since Norwood I think have made very clear that simply giving--

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: Can States give money to segregated schools, racially segregated schools, for example?

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: --Can States give money--

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: --to racially segregated schools?
Under this Court's State action cases I think they can.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: They can?

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: Norwood was a different situation.

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: That's the position of the Justice Department--

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: Norwood--

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: --that States can provide funding to racially segregated schools?

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: --It depends on the circumstances.
In Norwood--

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: It depends on the circumstances.

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: --Yes.
In Norwood--

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: That's astounding.

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: --It was a school system under a desegregation decree.
[Laughter]

Coming back to your question, Justice Breyer, if I may, certainly a compensatory program that is... has a compensatory reason to compensate for prior discrimination, for example, could be a single sex program that would be for only that gender because only that gender has a need for that, so at least in those two areas--

turn.speaker: david_h_souter
turn.label: Justice David H. Souter
turn.text: No, but I would suppose you could go--

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: --you could have that.

turn.speaker: david_h_souter
turn.label: Justice David H. Souter
turn.text: --one step further.

I thought you could, consistently with your position, and that is, if you've got a school system in which everybody says the results are terrible for everybody, and the school system made a decision that in fact they would get better results for everybody if certain classes at certain levels were segregated by sex, all males schools and all female schools, you wouldn't start with this implication of inferiority, and I would suppose that that might be okay.

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: That's also true, right.
That's, I think, the third part of the answer.

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: You mean you can do it case by case--

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: antonin_scalia
turn.label: Justice Antonin Scalia
turn.text: --and by a lawsuit.

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: I think single sex education that a State proposes for single sex reasons, unlike this case, where this is done just to comply with a court decree, if a State proposes a single sex system, the issue then is, is it truly an equal system, and that would have to be decided.
Justice O'Connor, with regard to the remedial question you raised before, I just... can I finish the sentence?

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Yes.

turn.speaker: paul_bender
turn.label: Mr. Paul Bender
turn.text: That might be more difficult if it were voluntary.
I think in the remedial context, there's a lot of problem with that kind of total separation unless it's necessary.
Thank you.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Thank you, Mr. Bender.
The case is submitted.
